availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Tevis and Elizabeth Devoss. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky, from 1836 to 1837. Graduated from the Medical College of Ohio in Cincinnati in 1838. Married to Mary Ann Barker on July 29, 1846. Father of Elizabeth Tevis, R. M. Tevis, Emma Tevis, Benjamin H. Tevis, and, John B. Tevis. Married to Martha Ellen Jett on December 19, 1865. Physician in Bracken County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860.
